alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 01 at 10:44AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF KAUAI IN KAUAI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Kauai in Kauai County. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1040 AM HST, radar indicated heavy showers and thunderstorms over western and northern portions of Kauai. Rain rates have diminished to around 1 inch per hour. Heavy rain and thunderstorms remain widespread offshore and may move over the island later this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kapaa, Kekaha, Princeville, Kilauea, Kokee State Park, Wainiha, Na Pali State Park, North Fork Wailua Trails, Hanalei, Haena, Wailua Homesteads, Waimea, Polihale, Wailua, Moloaa, Mana, Barking Sands, Anahola, Waimea Canyon State Park and Kalihiwai. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 1230 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
